facts.text: Survey Nos. 12 to 18 comprising 10 acres 54 cents in South Vallur village of Vijayawada Taluk are poramboke lands used for irrigation and drainage by villagers.

Plaintiffs (respondents 1 to 4) sued in representative capacity for declaration that suit lands are communal lands, challenged assignment to 2nd defendant by Estates Manager on December 21, 1952, sought permanent and mandatory injunctions.
2nd defendant (1st appellant) obtained grant from Zamindar under Patta Ex. B-8 dated January 15, 1946 for Survey Nos. 12 to 15, in possession since 1946.
After abolition of estates under Estates Abolition Act, 1948, Survey Nos. 16 to 18 held unnecessary for original purpose by Collector, granted to 2nd defendant by Estates Manager under Ex. B-16.
During pendency of suit, Patta granted to 2nd defendant under S.11 of Estates Abolition Act by Assistant Settlement Officer under Ex. B-30 dated December 10, 1955.
Trial court dismissed plaintiffs' suit, held plaintiffs failed to establish communal character and lands ceased to be communal due to authorities' orders.
First appellate court reversed trial court, decreed suit for plaintiffs, held lands communal with villagers' rights, defendants' orders invalid or ineffective.
Andhra Pradesh High Court in Second Appeal No. 644 of 1962 affirmed first appellate court by judgment dated August 29, 1966.

Collector, Krishna passed order Ex. A-1 dated October 29, 1946 under S.20-A(1)(a) Madras Estates Land Act declaring Survey Nos. 16,17,18 no longer required for original purpose (Agakodu P.W.D., Drainage channel, Poramboke), requested Zamindar to state reversionary rights.
No order passed under S.20-A(1)(b) converting Survey Nos. 16-18; Survey Nos. 12-15 continued as communal lands till estate abolition.
No material placed to show South Vallur Zamindari Estate included suit lands.
Estates Manager order dated December 21, 1952 (Ex. B-2) assumed Collector's order converted lands to ryotwari, granted to 2nd defendant.
Assistant Settlement Officer order Ex. B-30 made during suit pendency without notice to plaintiffs.

legal_issues.text: Whether the conclusion that suit lands are communal lands has no basis in evidence.
Whether civil court had jurisdiction to entertain the suit.
Whether communal rights in suit lands extinguished under S.3 of Estates Abolition Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: Conclusion by first appellate court and High Court that lands are communal has no basis in evidence.
Civil court had no jurisdiction due to S.189(1) of Madras Estates Land Act.
Communal rights extinguished under S.3 Estates Abolition Act.
Survey Nos. 16-18 ceased to be communal due to Collector's order Ex.A-1, Estates Manager order Ex.B-2, Asst Settlement Officer patta Ex.B-30 under S.11.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: S.20-A Madras Estates Land Act; S.11, S.56 Estates Abolition Act

respondent_arguments.text: Lands are communal with rights of irrigation and drainage; defendants' orders invalid.

court_reasoning.text: Appellants conceded before High Court that suit lands were once communal; S.Nos.12-15 continue as communal, controversy confined to 16-18.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Not permitted to reopen conceded facts.

court_reasoning.text: Collector's order Ex.A-1 only under S.20-A(1)(a), incomplete without (1)(b) order; lands remain communal.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Without written order under cl.(b), no assignment or use for other purpose.

court_reasoning.text: Estates Manager order Ex.B-2 based on erroneous assumption; no power to convert communal to ryoti lands.
Asst Settlement Officer patta Ex.B-30 under S.11 invalid: lands not ryoti or lanka; no notice; during suit pendency.
court_reasoning.key_observation: S.11 applies only to ryoti lands properly included in holding.

court_reasoning.text: S.56 finality not applicable as dispute not within its scope.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Dispute on communal nature not covered.

court_reasoning.text: Civil courts have jurisdiction under S.9 CPC; S.189 not attracted as no order under S.20-A(1), no reliance on relevant schedule items.
S.3 Estates Abolition Act vests estate in Government but does not abrogate villagers' communal rights not created by landholder.
No material Zamindari included suit lands; Zamindar had no right to grant communal lands per S.20,20-A.

holdings.text: Survey Nos. 12-18 continue as communal lands; appellants acquired no title; civil court had jurisdiction; communal rights not extinguished.
Civil courts have jurisdiction under S.9 CPC.
S.3 Estates Abolition Act does not extinguish pre-existing communal rights of villagers.

precedents_cited.case_name: Valathar Mooppannar and ors. v. The Board of Revenue, Madras
precedents_cited.relevance: Asst Settlement Officer had no competence to grant ryotwari patta for non-ryoti lands under S.11 Estates Abolition Act.

statutes_cited.name: Madras Estates Land Act, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Defined estate, ryot, ryoti land excluding communal lands; procedure for declaring/diverting communal lands; jurisdiction of revenue courts.

statutes_cited.name: Estates Abolition Act, 1948
statutes_cited.relevance: Vesting of estates in Government without abrogating villagers' communal rights; ryotwari patta only for ryoti lands; finality for specific disputes.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Civil courts' jurisdiction for civil disputes.

outcome.summary: Appeal by special leave dismissed; High Court judgment affirmed holding suit lands as communal with villagers' rights of irrigation and drainage; defendants' titles and orders invalid.
outcome.relief_granted: None to appellants; upholds plaintiffs' declaration and injunctions.

key_quotes.text: "Without the written order of the District Collector under clause (b) of sub-section (1), no land which is set apart for any of the purposes referred to in sub-clauses (a) and (b) of clause (16) of s. 3 shall be assigned or used for any other purpose."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains why Collector's order incomplete, lands remain communal.

key_quotes.text: "The rights of the community over the suit lands were not created by the principal or any other land-holder. Hence those rights cannot be said to have been abrogated by cl. (c) of s. 3."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Holds communal rights survive vesting under Estates Abolition Act.

key_quotes.text: "It is not in dispute that the lands S. Nos. 12 to 18 ... are poramboke lands. That they were used for the purpose of irrigation and drainage is also not in dispute."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Admits key facts conceded by parties.
